It is, however, possible to formulate a general domain-independent principle to capture conjunction constraints. This paper will describe such a principle, implemented as "conjunction restrictions" within the general treatment of conjunction in the natural language processing system of the Linguistic String Project parser. The illustrative examples are drawn from actual text occurrences in hospital discharge sunnnaries, processed using the mechanisms described below, as well as from some building code specifications, also processed with the LSP system.
